sep.mvc

Class AbstractController

  • java.lang.Object
    • sep.mvc.AbstractController

  • public abstract class AbstractController
extends java.lang.Object
    A Controller is used to assemble the Model and view(s), and is responsible for coordinating operations between them to form the application as a whole. The Controller is the central component that processes commands (from the user-driven view) and other events of interest (e.g., network I/O) by performing operations on the Model and view as appropriate.

    Alternative application behaviours can be realised by different Controllers over the same Model and views. Likewise, a Controller should be able to handle any view that observes a compatible command protocol.

    The binding of the Model and view to this Controller is fixed on creation.

      Constructors

      protected AbstractController(AbstractModel model, AbstractView view)
      Binds the supplied Model and View to this Controller.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractController

        protected AbstractController(AbstractModel model,
                             AbstractView view)
        Binds the supplied Model and View to this Controller. Also implicitly registers this Controller to the supplied View - this Controller will be shutdown if a Controller has already been bound to the View.
        Parameters:
        model - The Model
        view - The View
        See Also:
        AbstractView.setController(sep.mvc.AbstractController)

    • Method Detail

      • shutdown

        public abstract void shutdown()
        Shutdown this Controller, and the MVC application as whole. Implicitly closes the bound View.
